Description: Glazed composition scarab; pierced longitudinally; engraved elytra, head and legs and on the base the prenomen of Thutmose III in an oval between two maat feathers with uraei; glaze worn and faded to white; thought to have been manufactured well after Thutmose III's reign, in the 19th Dynasty, probably the Ramesside period.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 250)
Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (1563)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 105)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (P41, Pl IV)
Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (P. 165, No. 3)
